THE FOUR HUMAN RACES, ILLUSTRATION IN THE STANDARD SOCIAL STUDIES TEXTBOOK USED IN MIDDLE SCHOOLS IN FRANCE DURING THE 1880s AND 1890s

Art Collection 2 / Alamy Stock Photo

A caption below the image reads:The White Race, the most perfect of the human races, lives mostly in Europe, West Asia, North Africa, and North America. It is characterized by its oval head and rather thin lips. The complexion may vary in color but is generally light. The Yellow Race occupies mostly East Asia, China, and Japan. It is characterized by its high cheekbones and almond- shaped eyes. The Red Race, which once upon a time inhabited all of North and South America, has reddish skin, deeply set eyes, and a long and arched nose.Â The Black Race, which occupies mostly Africa and the southern parts of Oceania, has skin that is very dark, dark brown eyes, and curly hair.
content.question: The image and its caption provide evidence that would best help explain the ideas of which of the following ideologies that emerged in the late nineteenth century?
